video.title: Google Sheets - Full Course
video.description:
Learn how to use Google Sheets to create spreadsheets and work with data.

💻 Download course files: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1iDnxkyh4fx_55adKMQrt0Q8u544fxenZ?usp=sharing

✏️ Course created by Barton Poulson from datalab.cc.
🔗 Check out the datalab.cc YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/datalabcc
🔗 Watch more free data science courses at http://datalab.cc/

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
(Time codes coming soon.)
⌨️ Welcome
⌨️ Pictures first
⌨️ Anatomy of a spreadsheet
⌨️ Data types
⌨️ Formatting cells
⌨️ Tidy data
⌨️ Sharing files
⌨️ Sharing folders
⌨️ Entering data
⌨️ Importing data
⌨️ Copying & pasting data
⌨️ Notes
⌨️ Comments
⌨️ Chat
⌨️ Selecting & moving data
⌨️ Sorting data
⌨️ Filtering data
⌨️ Filter views
⌨️ Publishing files
⌨️ Version history
⌨️ REPT charts
⌨️ Bar charts with table data
⌨️ Bar charts with raw data
⌨️ Grouped bar charts
⌨️ Bar charts with highlighting
⌨️ Pie charts
⌨️ Histograms
⌨️ Line charts
⌨️ Timelines
⌨️ Sparklines
⌨️ Scatterplots
⌨️ Scatterplots with highlighting
⌨️ Automatic charts with Explore
⌨️ Publishing charts
⌨️ Cell references
⌨️ Counts, sums, & means
⌨️ Dates & times
⌨️ Selecting text
⌨️ Combining text & data
⌨️ Conditional formatting
⌨️ Next steps

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Wong Voon jinq
👾 hexploitation
👾 Katia Moran
👾 BlckPhantom
👾 Nick Raker
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster
👾 AppWrite

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: News shorts
topLevelComment.text:
Not sure if there has been an update since but an easier way to change the color for a specific line of a bar chart would be to go to:
chart editor>customize>series>format data point

Then just choose your data point and change the color

topLevelComment.author: Ashish Kumar
topLevelComment.text:
Can someone please help ?

I have created charts from my spreadsheet data . I am updating my data in the spreadsheet everyday . But it is not showing in the chart. How can my spreadsheet data be automatically reflect in the chart (As I update in spreadsheet).

For example, I have created the chart on 28/October/2022 for the data(19/oct/2022 to 28/oct/2022).
But when I entered data for 29/oct/2022 , it is not coming in the chart, how can I fix this?

topLevelComment.author: fhhsvnggbh
topLevelComment.text:
Google sheets is rubbish. You always need to put a bandaid on things or waste time working out a workaround... just go get Excel, its cheap or you can get a pirate version for free. Sheets is fickle, doesnt calculate efficently and is a huge resource hog thats incapable of serious business data analytics .  You need paid add ons to use professional looking graphs and other things, where as Excel just has it all built in and set for more professional presentations. 
So what if people can contribute to the one online. You can with excel too, however with excel you can save locally and keep a backup incase one of those stupid contributors wipes out selective formulas and entries. Yeah you can restore a sheet... yay, but all the work youve put in up to the point where youve noticed theyve screwed stuff up is gone. Graphs and visuals come first, except with sheets. Garbage
Honestly if your buisness wants to use gsuite, for any kind of professional evaluation and analytics, go the already established market leader microsoft, saving to the cloud is just trusting someone elses computer to keep your data safe and secure.

topLevelComment.author: Leonard Milcin
topLevelComment.text:
A small comment on your example at 6:07.
I need to interject and point out that you need to first understand the distribution of your data before you can calculating things like standard deviation.
Standard deviation only applies to data that has specific distribution (called standard distribution).
It is fine to look at the data through those numbers, the problem in your example is that those numbers are simply wrong. You can't say the set of data has standard deviation of 3.32 when in fact it has completely different distribution.
And same goes for fitting straight or other lines through data set.
Now, having an actual look at the data might be helpful in spotting some egregious analysis errors. But it won't catch all or more nuanced problems. And there are actually better way to say "Is my set distributed in a standard way?", "Is straight line a good choice to fit this data?"

topLevelComment.author: Repentance: The Missing Link Of True Salvation
topLevelComment.text:
Acts 20:21
King James Version
21 Testifying both to the Jews, and also to the Greeks, repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.

*Did you know you’re part of the ultimate statistics, 10 out of 10 people die. One day your heart will stop beating and you will be dead! The Bible says you’ll then be judged by the holy and righteous God who created this universe.(Hebrew 9:27)You’ll be judged for every word, thought, and action in your life.(Matthew 12:36-37) Will you be innocent or guilty?

*Let’s check the standard, the Ten Commandments. Have you ever lied (even a “white” lie)? (Revelation 21:8) Have you ever stolen anything (value is irrelevant and includes downloading or copying movies illegally)?  If you’ve lusted, you’ve committed adultery in your heart. (Matthew 5:27-30) (1 Corinthians 6:9-10)

If you’ve hated someone, the Bible says you’re a murderer(1 John 3:15). If you’ve done any of these things, you will be guilty, and end up in Hell. God is perfect and He hates sin, but He sent His Son, Jesus Christ, to die on the Cross to take the punishment you deserve. Then He rose from the grave – defeating death. (Luke 24:46-48)

Repent (turn from your sins) and trust in Jesus Christ to receive forgiveness and everlasting life. Read the Bible to learn about God and how to live. (Acts 20:21) 

*Do God’s will, plan and purpose in your life; these are above and beyond, immeasurable compare to your grandest dream.

* We obey God’s moral law the Ten Commandments because we love our Lord and saviour Jesus Christ, the Father and the Holy Ghost(John 14:15) (John 14:1-6) (John 14:16-26) (Mark 12:30-31)  with all our heart, soul, mind and all our strength, and we believe and have faith in Him; also we Fear Him with reverence with deep respect.
